title: Update color theme to black and white and improve code experiment formatting

requirements.summary: Update the entire UI color scheme to a black and white palette with monochromatic shades while maintaining good contrast and readability
acceptanceCriteria: All UI elements use only black, white, and grayscale colors
Text remains readable with sufficient contrast ratios
Interactive elements have clear hover and active states using grayscale variants
Background gradients and decorative elements use only black/white/gray tones

file_operations.description: Replace the current OKLCH color system with a monochromatic black and white palette using CSS custom properties for background, foreground, card, primary, secondary, muted, accent, and destructive color variants with grayscale values ensuring sufficient contrast ratios
Update the Tailwind theme configuration to reference the new black and white CSS variables, removing any colored accent definitions and ensuring all color references use the monochromatic palette
Replace the gradient background and decorative blur effects with black and white gradient variants using grayscale tones while maintaining the visual hierarchy and depth
Update card styling to use black, white, and gray colors for backgrounds, borders, hover states, and button elements while preserving the hover animations and interactive feedback
Replace the gradient styling with grayscale gradient effects and update all color references to use black, white, and gray variants for the card, avatar, and Instagram link
Update input fields, buttons, error messages, and countdown timer styling to use the monochromatic color scheme with clear visual feedback using grayscale variants for different states

requirements.summary: Improve code formatting and alignment within C++ experiment displays with proper indentation, spacing, and clean presentation
acceptanceCriteria: Code blocks display with proper monospace font
Indentation is preserved and visually consistent
Code is properly aligned within the card boundaries
Syntax structure is clearly visible and readable

file_operations.description: Format the hardcoded C++ code strings with proper indentation and spacing, ensuring consistent tab/space usage and preserving the code structure for both salary calculation and grade evaluation experiments

Update the content rendering to use a monospace font family, preserve whitespace with CSS white-space property, and ensure proper text wrapping and overflow handling for code blocks within card boundaries

requirements.summary: Ensure code experiments are fully copyable with proper text selection and copy functionality that preserves formatting and indentation
acceptanceCriteria: Users can select text within code blocks
Copy button preserves original code formatting including whitespace and indentation
Manual text selection and copy (Ctrl+C) works correctly
Copied code can be pasted into code editors with formatting intact

file_operations.description: Ensure the copy button functionality preserves all whitespace and indentation when copying to clipboard, and verify that the content area allows user text selection without CSS restrictions (remove user-select: none if present)

requirements.summary: Reduce excessive descriptive text around code experiments, keeping only essential experiment titles
acceptanceCriteria: Only experiment titles ('1st - Experiment', '2nd - Experiment') are shown as headers
No additional descriptive text or explanations appear around the code
Code content is the primary focus of each card

file_operations.description: Update the title prop for each AnswerCard to show only '1st - Experiment' and '2nd - Experiment' respectively, removing any additional descriptive text or explanations
Review and remove any additional labels, helper text, or commentary that may appear around the code content display, ensuring only the title and code block are rendered
